title.narrative: 2.1.2 ENHANCEMENT OF HIV PREVENTION

description.narrative: By end of 2016, The capacity of government and stakeholders for the enhancement of HIV prevention and responsebased on the requirements of adolescent and youth programming is increased, which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Health â€“ General, Hiv Prevention, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2016, national and sub-national organizations and institutions have increased capacities to develop, implement and/or strengthen programmes, systems and policies to improve health, development and access to opportunities for and with adolescents and young people.

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF HEALTH AND MEDICAL EDUCATION
VEZARAT DADGOSTARI NATIONAL BODY ON CONVENTION CHILDRE

sector.narrative: HIV testing including self testing and counselling in adolescents
Harm reduction among adolescent drug users
Support Policy and guidance developments and address barriers to accessing HIV services by adolescents including gender mainstreaming

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end of 2016, The capacity of government and stakeholders for the enhancement of HIV prevention and responsebased on therequirements of adolescent and youth programming is increased

description.narrative: National efforts to prevent risky behavior among adolescents and youth have been enhanced through UNICEF&39;s assistance in launching the All-In Initiative and institutional capacity building on bio-behavioural surveillance of the most at risk children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: Number of service providers trained on how to deliver services to the most-at risk and at risk adolescent and youth

actual.value: 2016:70 by the end of 2016. A technical training workshop on the role of inter-personal communication to reduce stigma and discrimination in HIV/AIDS prevention programs among youth and adolescent was held in Kurdistan province. Over 35 national and sub-national HIV/AIDS focal persons from MOHME as well

title.narrative: Number of health-based facilities applying AFS concepts and standards responsive to the needs of adolescents and youth
% of increase in the number of most at risk and at risk adolescent and youth (disaggregated by sex and age groups) utilizing services of the AFS centers
National HIV/AIDS strategies that include proven high-impact evidence-based interventions to address HIV among adolescents available

baseline.value: The HIV/AIDS National Strategic Plan does not include adequate focus on adolescents' services

target.value: 2016:An improved national HIV and AIDS Prevention, PMTCT, and Care Strategy with strong focus on prevention among adolescents is in place. (ALL-IN initiative)

actual.value: 2017:The adolescent-focused interventions for HIV prevention was suggested to the Ministry of Health- Centers for Disease Control for inclusion in the National Strategic Plan.
